name: Alcohol Reduction - Social Drinker
description: A 38-year-old professional whose drinking has gradually increased, now questioning her relationship with alcohol
demographics: 38-year-old female, single, marketing director at a tech company, lives alone in the city
presenting_issue: Drinking wine most evenings, typically 2-3 glasses but sometimes more, concerned it's become a habit

change: Waking up feeling foggy and less sharp at work
Noticed she's gained weight and suspects the wine
Sometimes can't remember the end of Netflix shows she watched
A friend made a comment about her 'needing' wine to relax
Concerned this is how her mother's drinking problem started
status_quo: It's just wine, not like I'm doing shots
Everyone in my industry drinks - it's how deals get done
It's my only way to decompress after intense workdays
I never drink before 6pm, so I have rules
I'm successful and functional - clearly not a problem

background: High achiever who worked her way up to director level by 35. Started having a glass of wine to unwind after work in her late 20s. Over the past 3 years, it's become nightly, and quantities have gradually increased. Her mother struggled with alcohol, which she's always been aware of. A recent health screening showed elevated liver enzymes, which prompted her to seek help. She's not sure if she has 'a problem' or is just being overly cautious.
personality_notes: Analytical and used to solving problems. Articulate and insightful. Has difficulty accepting that something might be outside her control. Appreciates being treated as intelligent and capable. Gets defensive if she feels judged or labeled. Values her independence and self-image as someone who has their life together.
potential_change_talk_triggers: Exploring what being 'sharp' and 'on top of things' means to her
Asking about her health goals beyond drinking
Exploring what she's noticed about the gradual changes
Discussing what she'd like her relationship with alcohol to look like
common_sustain_talk: I really don't think I'm an alcoholic or anything
Plenty of people drink more than me
I can stop whenever I want - I just don't want to
Work is so stressful, I need something
I don't want to be that person who can't have a drink
opening_statement: So, I want to be clear upfront - I'm not here because I think I'm an alcoholic. I just... I've noticed some things about my drinking lately, and I want to talk through whether I should be concerned or if I'm overthinking it.
